citation.article-title: Geomicrobium halophilum gen. nov., sp. nov., a moderately halophilic and alkaliphilic bacterium isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Geomicrobium (Ge.o.mi.cro′bi.um. Gr. n. ge soil; N.L. neut. n. microbium a microbe; N.L. neut. n. Geomicrobium a microbe from soil).
Cells are non-motile, Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, bean-shaped, approximately 0.5–0.7×1.0–1.2 μm and form irregular clusters with 2–20 cells.
Cell walls contain A1γ, meso-diaminopimelic acid-type murein.
No growth occurs in media without NaCl.
The DNA G+C content is 45 mol%.
The predominant isoprenoid quinones are MK-7 and MK-6.
Major cellular fatty acids are i-C15 : 0, i-C17 : 0 and i-C18 : 0.
The type species is Geomicrobium halophilum.
